Military funding: Allocation of funds for Marius's proposed veteran settlements in newly conquered territories to ensure loyalty and stability among the legions
Increase in military budget to support the expansion and professionalization of the Roman legions under Gaius Marius
Public projects: Debate on the funding and construction of new public granaries in Rome to stabilize grain prices and prevent famine
Proposal for the renovation and expansion of the Forum Romanum to accommodate the growing political and commercial activities
Personal ego projects: Discussion on endorsing a triumphal arch in honor of Lucius Cornelius Sulla for his victories in the Social War (91-88 BCE)
Military campaigns: Strategizing the next phases of Roman expansion into the Germanic territories and the potential military campaigns against the Cimbri and Teutones
Class rights: Debate over extending full Roman citizenship rights to Italian allies following the Social War, addressing the proposals by the populares faction
General laws: Introduction of a law to limit the power of the Senate by Gaius Marius, aiming to reduce the influence of the conservative optimates
Trade relations: Negotiations on new trade agreements with the Hellenistic kingdoms to secure a steady supply of grain and luxury goods
Foreign relations: Discussion on the formal diplomatic recognition of the Kingdom of Bithynia as a client state, ensuring its allegiance against Pontus
Religious matters: Proposal for the state funding of major religious festivals to bolster public morale and support traditional Roman values in face of growing foreign influences
Economic policy: Consideration of reforms to the tax farming system, particularly focusing on reducing corruption and abuses by publicani in the provinces
